text: On August 2, 2005, Air France Flight 358 was an Airbus A340 that overran the runway at Toronto Pearson International Airport, due to the pilots deploying the thrust reversers too slowly. Despite 12 people sustaining injuries, all 309 people on board the plane survived. ==Passengers== Nationality Passengers Crew Total 101 11 113 104 0 104 8 0 8 19 0 19 7 0 7 14 0 14 25 0 25 2 0 2 3 0 3 2 0 2 4 0 4 1 0 1 1 0 1 6 0 6 Total 297 12 309 ==Aftermath== Following the accident many flights departing from and arriving at Pearson were cancelled, and many other flights to Toronto Pearson were diverted to other Canadian airports such as Ottawa, London, Hamilton and Winnipeg. Many of the large aircraft were diverted to Montreal, as well as Syracuse, New York, and Buffalo, New York. Flights from Vancouver had to turn around. Around 540 flights were cancelled. ==Other websites== Category:Aviation accidents and incidents in 2005 Category:21st century in Ontario Category:2000s disasters in Canada Category:2005 in Canada Category:Air France accidents and incidents
title: Air France Flight 358
